revised_title: Investigation of the Constituent Minerals of Scottish Granites and Comparison with Donegal Granites
tldr: The author analyzes the constituent minerals of Scottish granites, specifically Orthoclase, Oligoclase, Albite, and Mica, and compares their composition and oxygen ratios to those of Donegal granites. The study reveals similarities and differences in the mineral composition of the two types of granites, providing insights into their geological origins and classification.
